document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Introducing cultural elements into training will be essential in many cases - Future Operating Environment 2035, Development, Concepts and Doctrine Centre, 2015.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Type of operation, presence of media and/or Very Important Persons (VIPs), cultural/religious behaviours, historical implications, infrastructure and building implications etc.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Every relevant task contained in the Role PS / Competence Framework should be analysed for its respective Fidelity requirements, based on the applicable fidelity categories.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Depending on the complexity of the capability involved, it may be necessary to articulate fidelity requirements at the sub-task level if those stated at the task level do not adequately capture the relevant fidelity criteria details.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Analysts should also consider the fidelity requirements of any team/collective Performance criteria that have been established in support of the new or revised capability, to contextualise the individual training need.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: However, analysts should not state fidelity requirements simply as ‘high, medium, low, none’ as this is unquantifiable and gives no meaningful guidance to designers of the eventual training solution.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Table 10: Levels of Fidelity Location / Environment Implications The training environment and implications of location for each training solution may well require analysis at this stage.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: For example, constraints on training resources and the availability of real equipment for training may force the emphasis towards workplace training.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The same would be true if it is not possible to replicate critical Role PS Conditions in training establishments or via distributed training.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is therefore important to determine an estimate of where the balance between training to be delivered in a training establishment and workplace training will fall.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is based on a careful analysis of exactly what the TRA requires, tempered by that which is deliverable and can only be achieved by consultation with the TRA and the Training Provider, who will have knowledge of existing training and current training facilities and resources.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: This will later result in the allocation of TOs to a TPS, WTS, or, where no training will take place, the Performance, Conditions and Standards to a RTGS32.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The output from this work could be an amendment to the Initial Training Categories or recommendations that take account of both DIF Analysis results and the impact of all other Role, training and resource factors.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is important to consider the most appropriate and effective blend of training Methods & Media options that provides the most effective balance of performance, cost and time in achieving the required KSA.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The Method used to deliver training depends on whether learning is categorised as Knowledge, a mental or physical Skill, or an Attitude.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: a Skills-based EO must have some element of practice involved in the Method; whilst role-play is an example of a training Method suitable for a Behaviour-based EO).

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Learning a physical Skill may require equipment and machinery and a low trainee-to-trainer ratio as it tends to be trainee-centric.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Knowledge learning is most effective and efficient via e-learning, in the form of a lecture, or with links to information.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Wherever possible, a learner-focused approach should be adopted although this is not always as simple as it seems as it can be time consuming and resource heavy.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: A learner-focused approach aids information retention by considering the needs of the trainees and increasing their involvement in the learning process.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Therefore, it is imperative that for the effective and efficient acquisition of the required KSA, time is built into the programme, to facilitate learning through reflection.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Learners are motivated to learn when they know the relevance of the learning, and when they are enabled to learn through a learner-centric way.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: For knowledge acquisition, motivation best comes through a flipped classroom, where the learners are required to access the learning (through e-learning for example) before they consolidate and reflect on what they have learnt, in the classroom.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Information should not be at a level that they cannot comprehend, nor should it be at a level which will patronise.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Key questions should include ‘What is the literacy level of the trainees?’ and ‘What is the most appropriate language for passing information?’ Numbers.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Facilities and resource availability are likely to limit the choice of Method and the most appropriate Media are not always practical or within budget.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The medium may be unavailable; there may not be time to meet all the TOs; it may be difficult logistically or financially; or the group may be of mixed ability and unable to make the best use of the Media selected.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Where resources to support the optimum training Method are not available, lack of availability is likely to affect the successful achievement of the TOs.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: A question that will need to be asked is: can, or will, the trainers be able to use the Media selected? Trainers are unlikely to use Media that they do not understand, which increases their workload, or which is complex to manage.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: If new teaching Methods are to be introduced, then due regard must be given to ensuring that trainers are both willing and able to cope.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: develop a trainer training strategy to enable trainers to explore new technologies followed by localised CPD activity to ensure awareness is maintained on TEL developments, including opportunities for TEL exploitation; as a minimum, trainers should be able to facilitate learning using the DLE.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The requirement to design training to meet the needs of different types of learners, including skill fade and learner-centric approaches in an increasing resource constraint environment places the training designer at the centre of the training design process.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Training Providers and 3rd Party Contractors will need to ensure their training designers are provided with sufficient training, expertise and resources in order to design training to meet the needs of Defence.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: For any NTS training design, key training design personnel should be invited to the TNA WG during TOA and TNR stage to plan for TEL interventions.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Training Providers/3rd Party Contractors to develop a training designer training strategy and plan to enable training designers to intelligently utilise TEL to facilitate a blended learning approach as to optimise efficiencies.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Where applicable, ensure that Training Providers’/3rd Party Contractors’ training designers are provided with OEM Train the Trainer (TtT) training prior to RFTD for all NTS capabilities.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Ensure the training designers are provided with all OEM TEL training documentation (hardcopy, electronic (Word, PDF, Interactive Electronic Training Manuals/Publications (IETM/Ps), media prior to any training design.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Develop a trainer training strategy to enable trainers to explore new technologies followed by localised CPD activity to ensure awareness is maintained on TEL developments, including opportunities for TEL exploitation.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: A lecture may seem to be an attractive option for passing large amounts of information in a relatively short time, but the information received by the trainees may be processed at only the most superficial level.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is therefore important that the training Method chosen should minimise this difference to make the transfer of KSA from the training environment to the work environment as easy as possible.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is unlikely that the various subjects to be trained will all be of equal importance to the trainees in their future Role.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Some Skills may be used on a daily basis while others may be only used sporadically but, when they are used, are essential.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The results of the DIF Analysis (1.3.3), the consideration of skill fade factors and/or the analysis of Critical Errors (1.3.3B) may have a significant influence on the Method selection.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: In subjects where the possibility of skill fade could have dire consequences, consideration must be given to ensuring that appropriate Methods & Media are implemented to enhance retention.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Consideration should be given to the characteristics of Media, in terms of whether they are essential or optional: Essential Media characteristics.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Cost Benefit Analysis In accordance with Defence and HM Treasury guidelines, an examination of the broad order costs of various options to recommend the most cost-effective training solution must be undertaken.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It is important that costing and investment appraisal are undertaken strictly in accordance with the current Defence and Service or Strategic Command policies and conventions.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: If training specialists become involved with costing or investment appraisal, they should obtain current advice from the TNASG or other authoritative body.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: CBA activity does not start at this stage of the TNA but the result of it is included in the Training Needs Report hence its inclusion here.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Like many aspects of DSAT, CBA is an iterative process with initial activity commencing much earlier in the TNA process, as appropriate.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: To evaluate the merits of the training locations and/or environments one of them should be selected as a baseline option.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The selection of a baseline will depend on the context, which then permits the construction of a table to display the relative merits of each option against the baseline.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Flexibility, or the ease with which the new training can be integrated with existing and potential future training, as appropriate.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It will typically be appropriate for the options evaluation to be undertaken in consultation with SMEs before presentation to the TNASG for endorsement.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Table 12 provides an example format: Table 11: Example of an Options Evaluation Table 34 It may be necessary to break down costs into greater detail to conduct evaluation.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Recommended Further Reading Guidebook of Decision Support Tools for Training Design and Delivery: Part 7 - Fidelity Analysis This guidebook is intended to support staff in the MOD, and contractors working for the MOD, in the challenges faced in understanding the effectiveness of training prior to it being delivered.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The aim of the Guidebook is to review the range of tools, methods and approaches that is available and recommend the most suitable approach.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Link: Guidebook of Decision Support Tools for Training Design and Delivery – Part 7 Fidelity Analysis Training Needs Report The Training Needs Report specifies the training requirement and recommends a training solution through the evaluation of options.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Training Needs Reports should collate all the information from the scoping exercise and analyses stages, adding an Implementation Plan and TNE strategy.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: It should also include a description of the TNA methodology in terms of the data gathering and analysis techniques and clearly reference the data sources consulted.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: The TNA can then be written up as a Training Needs Report that provides or supports detailed user and system requirements.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: Training Needs Reports should include: Identification of the Performance requirement: a Role PS / Framework(s) for each Role holder, as identified in the RA.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: A Role PS and/or Framework(s) for the Role(s) affected by the recommended training solution with recommended training categories and supportive notes to amplify specific requirements to be included as appropriate to assist designers with the production of the FTS.

document: DTSM 2 Analysis of Individual Training 2023 Edition V1.0.docx
content: At this stage the draft TOs endorsed by the TNASG should be available and expressed as Performance, Conditions and Standards to enable implementation by the design team.
